values.description:
Also provide our own unversioned setup.sh.

This pull request depends on an analogous [fix in Gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/178/adding-unversioned-setupsh-for-297/diff).

It's not ideal to push new files into a release branch like this, but it's a pretty important bug to fix.

Also started writing in Gazebo's install prefix, as determined at configure time, into drcsim's generated setup.sh (instead of assuming that drcsim is installing to the same prefix as Gazebo).  I left the fallback of checking /usr for convenience.

Update: retargeted this to default, to appear in 1.2.  It now pulls in some fixes that were done on the 1.1 branch.
values.title: source unversioned Gazebo setup.sh

summary.raw:
Also provide our own unversioned setup.sh.

This pull request depends on an analogous [fix in Gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/178/adding-unversioned-setupsh-for-297/diff).

It's not ideal to push new files into a release branch like this, but it's a pretty important bug to fix.

Also started writing in Gazebo's install prefix, as determined at configure time, into drcsim's generated setup.sh (instead of assuming that drcsim is installing to the same prefix as Gazebo).  I left the fallback of checking /usr for convenience.

Update: retargeted this to default, to appear in 1.2.  It now pulls in some fixes that were done on the 1.1 branch.
summary.html:
Also provide our own unversioned setup.sh.

This pull request depends on an analogous fix in Gazebo.

It's not ideal to push new files into a release branch like this, but it's a pretty important bug to fix.

Also started writing in Gazebo's install prefix, as determined at configure time, into drcsim's generated setup.sh (instead of assuming that drcsim is installing to the same prefix as Gazebo). I left the fallback of checking /usr for convenience.

Update: retargeted this to default, to appear in 1.2. It now pulls in some fixes that were done on the 1.1 branch.

values.title: backing out merged p3d plugin from drcsim_1.1 (pull request #44) (issue #61)

values.description:
I needed ground truth pose information from gazebo, so I brought the gazebo_ros_p3d plugin to be built with the other ROS plugins in drcsim. I also added the plugin to the SDF file of the robot, but I'm not sure if that's something you'll also want.

This is a duplicate of pull request #44, but it was accepted into the wrong branch. 

Note the Diff's are generating changes to files that I did not make changes to. I'm not exactly sure how to deal with this, as I'm relatively new to using Mercurial & bitbucket.
values.title: Adding ground truth plugin information into Default branch (gazebo_ros_p3d)

values.title: fix for issue #68
Joint::Load for gazebo 1.3 backwards compatibility

values.description: Per Issue #74, when launching `atlas.launch` in drcsim-1.3 with the VRCPlugin, there are ROS_ERROR's thrown, when they should be ROS_INFO. This changes them to ROS_INFO. Also, check to see if the vehicle exists before trying to enter or exit the car. This will prevent a segfault if someone publishes to those topics when the drc_vehicle doesn't exist.
values.title: Resolve issue 74: ROS errors should be ROS info

summary.raw: Per Issue #74, when launching `atlas.launch` in drcsim-1.3 with the VRCPlugin, there are ROS_ERROR's thrown, when they should be ROS_INFO. This changes them to ROS_INFO. Also, check to see if the vehicle exists before trying to enter or exit the car. This will prevent a segfault if someone publishes to those topics when the drc_vehicle doesn't exist.
summary.html: Per Issue #74, when launching atlas.launch in drcsim-1.3 with the VRCPlugin, there are ROS_ERROR's thrown, when they should be ROS_INFO. This changes them to ROS_INFO. Also, check to see if the vehicle exists before trying to enter or exit the car. This will prevent a segfault if someone publishes to those topics when the drc_vehicle doesn't exist.

values.description: This is a temporary fix for issue #69, adds contact sensors in the feet and some of the multisense model changes. I used an xmldiff tool to compare models/atlas/model.urdf with the output of `roscd atlas_utils; rosrun xacro xacro.py robots/atlas.model.xacro` and manually synchronized.
values.title: Manually synchronize atlas xacro files with downstream model.urdf

summary.raw: This is a temporary fix for issue #69, adds contact sensors in the feet and some of the multisense model changes. I used an xmldiff tool to compare models/atlas/model.urdf with the output of `roscd atlas_utils; rosrun xacro xacro.py robots/atlas.model.xacro` and manually synchronized.

values.description: The vehicle has some bad behavior when making joint commands outside of the established joint limits. This pull request fixes that behavior by respecting the joint limits (see 288da64). This pull request also removes some commented ROS code from DRCVehiclePlugin and changes a gzerr to ROS_ERROR.
values.title: Fix for issue #80: DRCVehiclePlugin joint limits

summary.raw: The vehicle has some bad behavior when making joint commands outside of the established joint limits. This pull request fixes that behavior by respecting the joint limits (see 288da64). This pull request also removes some commented ROS code from DRCVehiclePlugin and changes a gzerr to ROS_ERROR.
summary.html: The vehicle has some bad behavior when making joint commands outside of the established joint limits. This pull request fixes that behavior by respecting the joint limits (see 288da64). This pull request also removes some commented ROS code from DRCVehiclePlugin and changes a gzerr to ROS_ERROR.

values.description:
Make [multisense_sl_description ros package](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/bb659d950e8e1971a28111e92479881b3682f17c/ros/multisense_sl_description?at=mutisense_sl_urdf) the pre-install source.

Install `multisense_sl_description` gazebo model under `share/gazebo_models/multisense_sl_description/multisense_sl_description.

fix multicamera for synchronized camera for consistent stereo calculation.

Resolution of multisense sl has been downgraded to 1024X544 for performance.

Install `multisense_sl_description` gazebo model under `share/gazebo_models/multisense_sl_description/multisense_sl_description.

fix multicamera for synchronized camera for consistent stereo calculation.

Resolution of multisense sl has been downgraded to 1024X544 for performance.
summary.html:
Make multisense_sl_description ros package the pre-install source.

Install multisense_sl_description gazebo model under `share/gazebo_models/multisense_sl_description/multisense_sl_description.

fix multicamera for synchronized camera for consistent stereo calculation.

Resolution of multisense sl has been downgraded to 1024X544 for performance.

values.description:
this commit uses some files in sandia_hand (a YAML file with strawman controller gains, and a simple eigengrasp type controller) that will require installing a new sandia_hand deb. Once you do that, then you can command the hand in 1-dof spaces, like this:    

rosrun sandia_hand_teleop simple_grasp_client.py left spherical 0.5

which is kind of neat.
values.title: more sandia hand integration

summary.raw:
this commit uses some files in sandia_hand (a YAML file with strawman controller gains, and a simple eigengrasp type controller) that will require installing a new sandia_hand deb. Once you do that, then you can command the hand in 1-dof spaces, like this:    

rosrun sandia_hand_teleop simple_grasp_client.py left spherical 0.5

which is kind of neat.
summary.html:
this commit uses some files in sandia_hand (a YAML file with strawman controller gains, and a simple eigengrasp type controller) that will require installing a new sandia_hand deb. Once you do that, then you can command the hand in 1-dof spaces, like this:

rosrun sandia_hand_teleop simple_grasp_client.py left spherical 0.5

which is kind of neat.

values.title: adding multisense_sl/imu
Infer ROS_DISTRO from environment (issue #88).  Also check that ROS_ROOT is set.
Added drc_vehicle to gazebo_models and created a launch file for atlas with the drc_vehicle
Run state_publisher instead of robot_state_publisher, issue #90.  It looks like state_publisher exists in both fuerte and groovy.

values.description:
Added/updated hz tests for all published topics in the current API, spanning atlas.launch and atlas_sandia_hands.launch. Split GPU-dependent tests into separate files and added minimal GL-detection logic in CMakeLists.txt to gate execution of those tests. This is the start of addressing issue #95.

Moved launch of sandia hand state publishers to a sandia-specific file, issue #96.

Fixed a minor typo in a debug message.
values.title: Add hztests

summary.raw:
Added/updated hz tests for all published topics in the current API, spanning atlas.launch and atlas_sandia_hands.launch. Split GPU-dependent tests into separate files and added minimal GL-detection logic in CMakeLists.txt to gate execution of those tests. This is the start of addressing issue #95.

Moved launch of sandia hand state publishers to a sandia-specific file, issue #96.

Fixed a minor typo in a debug message.
summary.html:
Added/updated hz tests for all published topics in the current API, spanning atlas.launch and atlas_sandia_hands.launch. Split GPU-dependent tests into separate files and added minimal GL-detection logic in CMakeLists.txt to gate execution of those tests. This is the start of addressing issue #95.

Moved launch of sandia hand state publishers to a sandia-specific file, issue #96.

Fixed a minor typo in a debug message.

values.description:
got 1ms sim time in round trip

AP publish JS --> standalone subscriber subscribe JS, copy header time stamp from JS to JC --> publish JC in callback for JS --> AP JC subscriber thread receives and memcpy JC to member variable --> AP uses JC to update control torque, JC has time stamps that is consistently 1ms behind current sim time.

Changed to ROS topic over UDP.

Changed topic buffer sizes for JointState and JointCommands to 1. 

Changed vector element copy to memcpy on receipt of JointCommands for efficiency.

Update pub_joint_commands test.
values.title: controller api timing test

Changed to ROS topic over UDP.

Changed topic buffer sizes for JointState and JointCommands to 1. 

Changed vector element copy to memcpy on receipt of JointCommands for efficiency.

Update pub_joint_commands test.

AP publish JS --> standalone subscriber subscribe JS, copy header time stamp from JS to JC --> publish JC in callback for JS --> AP JC subscriber thread receives and memcpy JC to member variable --> AP uses JC to update control torque, JC has time stamps that is consistently 1ms behind current sim time.
